content:
Hi, I want to use Iff.subst, but I cannot get to import it.
When I'm just using subst, the Eq.subst one is chosen. I've tried importing Init.Core and opening numerous namespaces but I think it's in none of them. How can I get to use it? regards
I don't think an mve is required, is it(can't really imagine one and the context I need it in is an overkill for an mve)? I really just need an info on how to import it

In an empty .lean file, writing

#check Iff.subst
-- Iff.subst {a b : Prop} {p : Prop → Prop} (h₁ : a ↔ b) (h₂ : p a) : p b

makes me see that Iff.subst is already available: no imports needed!
ah uff sorry I see. The error said "unknown tactic" which always makes me think that it cannot find it but is expecting a tactic altough it has found the theorem but it wasn't a tactic.
haha this is the fourth time I'm getting hung up on exactly this because my focus is somewhere else and then I just kind of go with it sorry
Robert hackman has marked this topic as resolved.

If you had made a #mwe then your question would have been answered more quickly because your error would have been pointed out immediately. I will reiterate that the best way to ask questions here is to post code.
